result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnnie Diamond Premetz Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnnie Diamond Premetz Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Johnnie Diamond Premetz Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant was not produced, appearance waived. Due to in-custody status, court vacates the stayed bench warrant. Case remains in resolution posture. Matter is adjourned for plea and sentencing. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Johnnie Diamond Premetz not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer from the state. Defense requests resolution date. 
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 13.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Pick 'N Save
No Contact Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

09:57 AM Defendant Johnnie Diamond Premetz in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Johnnie Diamond Premetz in custody at HOC.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Johnnie Diamond Premetz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
